basics.name: Cameron Jones
basics.label: PhD Candidate, Australian National University
basics.summary: PhD Candidate researching advanced wavefront sensing for adaptive optics applied to free space optical communication. I use lasers to do cool things.

work.name: Finisar
work.summary: Managed LCOS SLM line worth $1.5M p.a. including product development, customer management/collaboration, and quality control.
highlights: Managed LCOS SLM line, worth $1.5M p.a. including product development, customer management/collaboration, quality control
Wrote, Tested and Deployed automated unit testing software for SLM line, saving 400 hours of operator labour p.a.
Successfully launched and transferred to production Finisar's 4th generation SLM
Developed a power cycling test solution to test thousands of units to verify stability of High-Resolution OCM line for large international telecommunications customer
Consulted to U.S. firm to deploy an experiment on site with no overruns or budget blowouts
Designed new instrument front panels for entire instrumentation department for Finisar to Coherent re-branding effort
Delivered lecture to UQ on transition from study to employment, represented Finisar at UNSW Electrical and Communication Engineering Society Employment Fair
Consulted to Finisar to assist with SLM line handover after they hired replacement

work.name: University of Sydney
work.summary: Physics tutor and demonstrator for first year physics and Kickstart physics program.
highlights: Tutored first year physics class of 2020, adapted under pressure to COVID guidelines, transitioning from in person to online and hybrid tutorials
Demonstrated for Kickstart physics 2019-2020 and 2023-Current, hosting high school students and running them through experiments

work.name: Private Tutoring
work.summary: Private tutoring for mathematics and physics from year 5 through university level.
highlights: Taught dozens of students from year 5 to university calculus
Multiple students achieved >90 ATAR
Experience with multiple special needs students

volunteer.summary: Volunteered with SPIN for the International Day of Light 2024
Active member in running Australia's first co-operative owned brewery
highlights: Hosted several events, including science outreach events, Physics in the Pub and other public lectures
Assisted in operations, managing events and logistics
Worked behind the bar

volunteer.summary: Led the University of Sydney Physics Society as President
highlights: Successfully continued the PhySoc Industry Networking Night into its second year
Maintained a professional network of corporate and academic relationships
Successful sponsorship run to raise funds to continue operations without cash injection from the University
Organized dozens of successful events including guest lectures from notable science communicators including Dr Karl and Physics YouTuber 'Tibees'
